msg: Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository

When a UIMovieClip resizes, it does so through scaling. Before UIMC was keeping track of this on it's own.  Now that AdvancedLayoutFeatures support this through scaleX/scaleY, UIMC can now rely on this behavior.  This also helps fix some Effects bugs which rely on this to figure out the difference in transformations that get applied and contribute to the "width" and "height" properties and ones that don't.
QE notes: Can re-include the 3 FCK tests and regen the bitmaps
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
Fixing a bunch of Flash Component Kit bugs.
SDK-20269: Add exclude metadata for placeholder components
SDK-20670: Setting the content of a ContainerMovieClip in ActionScript doesn't size the new items
SDK-20710: ContainerMovieClip shows Flex placeholder image when Placeholder is not on the first frame
SDK-21094: Animating TransformOffset scale values on ContainerMovieClip/UIMovieClip causes size to explode to huge values
SDK-16673: Cannot have two instances of FlexContentHolder in separate SWC files, only one shows up.
For SDK-20710, we now support containers where the FlexContentHolder is not present in the first frame.  This makes creating an expanding panel relatively easy and with no code.

Had to modify the build.xml to build from a manifest file--otherwise we're not exporting the files correctly and Flash authoring won't understand them.  Because of this, I've made a change in the project files for the flash-integration Flex Builder project (and the utilities one)
QE Notes: There's a new MXP File for Flash Authoring.  I'll be making this change in the 3.x branch as well.
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
The changes here are mostly fixing some sizing issues.

For the FlashContainerPlaceholder, the first child is now MyFlexContentHolder, which extends mx.flash.FlexContentHolder but meets the invariant that it has 1 child and that child is  FlexContentHolderThumbnail, which I’ve added as a swc to the project.  I changed this by accident last time to refer to mx.flash.FlexContentHolder, when it should've referred to a concrete instance created by Flash from a swc.  I also added a chrome of 151x151 to match the FlexContentHolderThumbnail since otherwise the container itself would have no chrome at all, and this let’s it size correctly.

Also, for sizing, in a container, rather than sizing to the size of the chrome, I now size to the size of the FlexContentHolder thumbnail that all FlexContentHolder’s have.  This means in ContainerMovieClip, I don’t need to override bounds anymore.
Also, I fixed a resizing event bug in UIMovieClip where the resize event was getting dispatched more than once.
